intro: Sisymbrium subscandens, commonly known as the climbing winter cress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features branched stems that are often hairy. The plant has small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and often have a peppery scent when crushed. It is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in waste areas, where it can form dense colonies.
